p: Chemotypes significantly impact the economic value of plants, as they affect the biological effect, yield, and quality of plant material, due to the differentiation in chemical composition. A study about Murraya koenigii (L.) Spreng. (Rutaceae), also known as curry tree, presented two chemotypes, chemotype A, rich in pinene and sabinene, and chemotype B, which does not accumulate sabinene. The authors noted that sabinene contributes to aroma and flavor and highlighted that pinene and sabinene are valuable to the flavor industry, therefore, chemotype A is ideal for commercialization [ 4].
